author: Odeinoichus
title: Riff Raff, Street Rat, Better Buy That.
review:
Set #71012 Aladdin: Aladdin was one of Disney's big break-out hits and the first to feature big name star power. Making him in Minifigure form seemed to be a no-brainer.

Aladdin looks great, he's got bare arms on a double-sided torso print with his little open-chest vest and the belt around his waist. His legs have minor printing, no dual-molding for his bare feet here, and his head is single sided with a happy looking smirk and the scruffy looking hair piece with little fez on it is a great new sculpt.

For accessories he includes the Genie lamp piece. Aladdin is a great minifigure and one of the must-have from this sub-theme. Here's hoping we'll see a Disney Series 2 so Jasmine can be included, and Jafar, can't have an Aladdin without a Jafar. Strongly recommended.
